transcription.text: Magic lantern set effects slide with wooden frame. The coloured slide shows a portrait of a man wearing a hat in a circular slide. An adjustable handle allows the viewer to move a beard.

work.title: Man and Donkey lever magic lantern slide

transcription.text: Magic lantern set effects slide with wooden frame. The coloured slide shows a flower bud blooming. Two adjustable sliding  pieces of glass - slide left and right to show the flower blooming. Set against a black background. Made by W.F. Archer, Liverpool, 43 Lord St and 63 South Castle St. '49' and 'R' written in pencil on wooden frame.

work.title: Magic lantern three-panel slipping slide (Flower Bloom)

transcription.text: Magic lantern set effects slide with dark wooden frame. By sliding the effects slide, a a figure changes from girl features to boy features. Set against a black background. Brown tape adhered to moving slide.

Magic lantern set effects slide with dark wooden frame. By sliding the effects slide, a a princess pushes a knight from her window or cuts his climbing rope, resulting in his fall Set against a black background.

work.title: Magic lantern slipping slide (Knight and Princess)

transcription.text: Production props of assorted scupting tools used in the creation of Prosthetics.

work.title: Sculpting tools for use in creating  prosthetics

transcription.text: Hand painted magic lantern slide showing a girl jumping rope

work.title: Magic lantern slipping slide (Girl jumping rope)

transcription.text: Production props of blocks of Plasteline used as a mediium in the creation of Prosthetics.

work.title: Plasteline blocks for use in creating  prosthetics

transcription.text: Production props of moulds for casting prosthetics.

work.title: Moulds: assorted sizes for casting prosthetics
Malcolm remote-controlled VW Buggy spare parts

transcription.text:
"Simply being in the presence of a giant Sequoia tree catalyses an experience that embeds us in planetary cycles and shared natural rhythms. If you could explore yourself, you would discover that just under your skin you are a branching being made of rivers, whirlpools and ripples in the tides of existence. Bringing the invisible into this view and exploring the symbiosis of everything can transform our understanding of the world – and how we interact with it.”
- Robin McNicholas of Marshmallow Laser Feast
